page.title: 06WEMBLEY FEVER 1985
page.content: The match was played on May 4th 1985. I was travelling down to{Wembley}to watch it with my older brother Colin and my dad. I had been looking forward to it for weeks. I was also looking forward to the train journey because I had never been so far by train. The kick off was 3 o'clock. We had arrived in plenty of time. Before the big match there was a schoolboy game which I enjoyed. Then a representative of all the past finals came onto the pitch.We all cheered for Billy Boston. In the first half Henderson Gill and David Stephenson both scored goal kicks. In the second half Shaun Edwards, John Ferguson and Brett Kenny all scored tries. The final score was {28-24}to{Wigan.}It was a very exciting match. Both teams and spectators were very sporting. When we got home there was hot-pot for supper. (Gary Lewis)
